	We are seeking a highly skilled, detail-oriented Female Chartered Accountant to manage and oversee the financial operations of a high-end luxury lounge and club located in Abuja.

Female Chartered Accountant Job at Xpedient Services




        
    

        
        Xpedient Services is a human resource management, training and consulting company. We Offer innovative seamless HR services which includes recruitment, training, organizational restructuring, HR payroll and other services that meets both individuals, small, medium and large organizational needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Female Chartered Accountant

Job Location: Wuse 2, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly skilled, detail-oriented Female Chartered Accountant to manage and oversee the financial operations of a high-end luxury lounge and club located in Abuja.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for all financial management functions, including budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, internal controls, payroll, and compliance.
	This role requires a professional with strong ethics, the ability to work independently, and a deep understanding of the unique financial dynamics of the hospitality and entertainment industry.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
	Handle daily accounting operations including receivables, payables, and cash management.
	Develop and monitor budgets and forecasts in alignment with business goals.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory and tax authorities.
	Liaise with external auditors, banks, and stakeholders.
	Oversee payroll, tax remittances, and statutory deductions (PAYE, VAT, etc.).
	Monitor and control expenses to improve profitability.
	Conduct internal audits and implement internal controls to reduce financial risk.
	Provide strategic financial analysis to support management decisions.
	Supervise accounting assistants or clerical staff if applicable.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum of 3 – 5 years of accounting experience, preferably in hospitality, club/lounges, or fast-paced service environments.
	Fully qualified Chartered Accountant (ICAN or ACCA required).
	Proficient in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Excel).
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian tax laws, hospitality accounting, and financial regulations.
	High level of integrity, confidentiality, and professionalism.
	Excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills.
	Ability to work flexible hours and manage financial tasks around busy lounge/club operations.


Ideal Candidate Profile:


	Female professional with prior experience in a similar hospitality or nightlife environment.
	Strong presence, confidence, and accountability.
	Reliable, trustworthy, and highly disciplined.
	Able to adapt to the fast-paced and dynamic nature of lounge/club operations.


Remuneration
Attractive and competitive, based on experience.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV and a short Cover Letter highlighting their relevant experience to: chizimushie@xpedient.services using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Customer Service Officer Job at Optimus Bank




        
    

        
        Optimus Bank is a digital-driven financial service platform built with a bold ambition of offering optimum banking experiences to millions of customers globally.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Officer

Job Location: Jigawa
Job Type: Full-time

Responsibilities 
     

            
    




	Ensure effective and timely service delivery to customers at all customer service unit.
	Ensure efficient Turn Around Time (TAT)in line with service level agreements.
	Ensure timely and error free processing.
	Ensure timely execution of end-of-day procedures including reports.
	Ensure effective utilization- of-physical assets at the Customer Service Unit
	Recommend Process Improvements as it relates to Customer Service in a bid to ensure service efficiency and cost minimization.
	Ensure Zero Fraud Tolerance and Regulatory Infraction
	Effective Cost Management to ensure that Customer Service sub-units are efficient.
	Perform Account maintenance function which includes account upgrade and update, stop cheques, standing instruction, internet banking, Account restriction request and removal etc.)
	Drive digital adoption in the branch.
	Maintain and update customer files


Requirements
Education/Qualification


	A Bachelor of either Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or any related field.


Experience


	Minimum of 2 years of banking experience in Customer Service.
